definitions.text: the side that is forward or prominent
the line along which opposing armies face each other
the outward appearance of a person
examples: he put up a bold front

definitions.text: the side that is seen or that goes first
a person used as a cover for some questionable activity
a sphere of activity involving effort
examples: the Japanese were active last week on the diplomatic front
they advertise on many different fronts

definitions.text: (meteorology) the atmospheric phenomenon created at the boundary between two different air masses
the immediate proximity of someone or something
examples: he sensed the presence of danger
he was well behaved in front of company

definitions.text: the part of something that is nearest to the normal viewer
examples: he walked to the front of the stage

definitions.text: a group of people with a common ideology who try together to achieve certain general goals
examples: he was a charter member of the movement
politicians have to respect a mass movement
he led the national liberation front

definitions.text: be oriented in a certain direction, often with respect to another reference point; be opposite to
examples: My backyard look onto the pond

definitions.text: relating to or located in the front
